actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

H.R. 1568 (Rep. Waltz):
        A bill to amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to protect personally identifiable information, and for other purposes.

        -- Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 538 (Sen. Hyde-Smith):
        A resolution commending Blue Mountain Christian University for 150 years of service to the State of Mississippi and the United States.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 539 (Sen. Rubio):
        A resolution supporting the contributions of Catholic schools in the United States and celebrating the 50th annual National Catholic Schools Week.

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN119:
        Joseph Goffman, of Pennsylvania, to be an Assistant Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 49. Record Vote Number: 29 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 49. Record Vote Number: 30

        Joan Polaschik, in the Foreign Service

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.

By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Merkley, at  7:09 p.m., the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until 11 a.m. tomorrow.
